member.summary:
Initializes the ddm library.
This must be called once before any call to CreateBridge.

members.member: Creates a {@link AndroidDebugBridge} that is not linked to any particular executable. This bridge will expect adb to be running. It will not be able to start/stop/restart adb. If a bridge has already been started, it is directly returned with no changes

member.name: M:Managed.Adb.AndroidDebugBridge.CreateBridge(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new debug bridge from the location of the command line tool.
member.param: the location of the command line tool 'adb'
force creation of a new bridge even if one with the same location already exists.
member.returns: a connected bridge.
member.remarks: Any existing server will be disconnected, unless the location is the same and forceNewBridge is set to false.

member.name: M:Managed.Adb.AndroidDebugBridge.HasInitialDeviceList
member.summary: Returns whether the bridge has acquired the initial list from adb after being created.
member.remarks:
Calling getDevices() right after createBridge(String, boolean) will generally result in an empty list. This is due to the internal asynchronous communication mechanism with adb that does not guarantee that the IDevice list has been built before the call to getDevices().
The recommended way to get the list of IDevice objects is to create a IDeviceChangeListener object.
member.returns: true if [has initial device list]; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Managed.Adb.AndroidDebugBridge.CheckAdbVersion
member.summary: Queries adb for its version number and checks it against #MIN_VERSION_NUMBER and MAX_VERSION_NUMBER

member.name: M:Managed.Adb.AndroidDebugBridge.ScanVersionLine(System.String)
member.summary: Scans a line resulting from 'adb version' for a potential version number.
member.returns: true if a version number was found (whether it is acceptable or not).
member.remarks: If a version number is found, it checks the version number against what is expected by this version of ddms.

member.name: M:Managed.Adb.AndroidDebugBridge.GrabProcessOutput(System.Diagnostics.Process,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String},System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Get the stderr/stdout outputs of a process and return when the process is done. Both must be read or the process will block on windows.
member.param: The process to get the ouput from
The array to store the stderr output. cannot be null.
The array to store the stdout output. cannot be null.
if true, this will wait for the reader threads.
member.returns: the process return code.

member.name: M:Managed.Adb.Conversion.EndianBitConverter.IsLittleEndian
member.summary: Indicates the byte order ("endianess") in which data is converted using this class.
member.remarks: Different computer architectures store data using different byte orders. "Big-endian" means the most significant byte is on the left end of a word. "Little-endian" means the most significant byte is on the right end of a word.
member.returns: true if this converter is little-endian, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Managed.Adb.Logs.EventLogParser.ParseBinaryEvent(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Object})
member.summary:
Recursively convert binary log data to printable form.
This needs to be recursive because you can have lists of lists.
If we run out of room, we stop processing immediately. It's important for us to check for space on every output element to avoid producing garbled output.
member.param: List in which to parse the data
member.returns: Returns the amount read on success, -1 on failure.

member.name: T:Managed.Adb.Logs.EventValueDescription
member.summary:
Describes an EventContainer value. This is a stand-alone object, not linked to a particular Event. It describes the value, by name, type EventValueType, and (if needed) value unit ValueType.
The index of the value is not contained within this class, and is instead dependent on the index of this particular object in the array of EventValueDescription returned by EventLogParser#ValueDescriptionMap when queried for a particular event tag.

member.name: T:Managed.Adb.Logs.GcEventContainer
member.summary:
Custom Event Container for the Gc event since this event doesn't simply output data in int or long format, but encodes several values on 4 longs.
The array of EventValueDescriptions parsed from the "event-log-tags" file must be ignored, and instead, the array returned from #getValueDescriptions() must be used.

member.name: M:Managed.Adb.MoreLinq.MoreEnumerable.PreScan``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Func{``0,``0,``0},``0)
member.summary: Performs a pre-scan (exclusive prefix sum) on a sequence of elements.
member.remarks: An exclusive prefix sum returns an equal-length sequence where the N-th element is the sum of the first N-1 input elements (the first element is a special case, it is set to the identity). More generally, the pre-scan allows any commutative binary operation, not just a sum. The inclusive version of PreScan is . This operator uses deferred execution and streams its result.
member.typeparam: Type of elements in source sequence
member.returns: The scanned sequence

member.name: M:Managed.Adb.ChunkHandler.#ctor
member.summary: Prevents a default instance of the class from being created.

members.member:
Client is ready. The monitor thread calls this method on all handlers when the client is determined to be DDM-aware (usually after receiving a HELO response.)
The handler can use this opportunity to initialize client-side activity. Because there's a fair chance we'll want to send a message to the client, this method can throw an IOException.
Client has gone away. Can be used to clean up any resources associated with this client connection.

Handle an incoming chunk. The data, of chunk type "type", begins at the start of "data" and continues to data.limit().
If "isReply" is set, then "msgId" will be the ID of the request we sent to the client. Otherwise, it's the ID generated by the client for this event. Note that it's possible to receive chunks in reply packets for which we are not registered.
The handler may not modify the contents of "data".
Handle chunks not recognized by handlers. The handleChunk() method in sub-classes should call this if the chunk type isn't recognized.

Utility function to copy a string out of a ByteBuffer.
This is here because multiple chunk handlers can make use of it, and there's nowhere better to put it.
Utility function to copy a string into a ByteBuffer.
Convert a 4-character string to a 32-bit type.
Convert an integer type to a 4-character string.

Allocate a ByteBuffer with enough space to hold the JDWP packet header and one chunk header in addition to the demands of the chunk being created.
"maxChunkLen" indicates the size of the chunk contents only.
Return the slice of the JDWP packet buffer that holds just the chunk data.

Write the chunk header at the start of the chunk.
Pass in the byte buffer returned by JdwpPacket.getPayload().

member.summary: Provides Device side file listing service.

member.name: F:Managed.Adb.FileListingService.LS_PATTERN_EX
member.summary:
This is the pattern that supports busybox ls and toolbox ls. Groups
Permissions
Group
Owner
Size, if empty or whitespace use 0
Month Name (or year in toolbox ls)
Date (or month number in toolbox ls)
Year, if empty, use current year (or date number in toolbox ls)
Time, if empty, use 00:00
Name
File types (or empty in toolbox ls)
member.remarks: added non-capture "(?:\d{1,},\s+)?" for "blocks"

member.name: M:Managed.Adb.IO.LinuxPath.ChangeExtension(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Changes the extension of a path string.
member.returns: A string containing the modified path information.On Windows-based desktop platforms, if path is null or an empty string (""), the path information is returned unmodified. If extension is null, the returned string contains the specified path with its extension removed. If path has no extension, and extension is not null, the returned path string contains extension appended to the end of path.
member.param: The new extension (with a leading period). Specify null to remove an existing extension from path.
The path information to modify. The path cannot contain any of the characters defined in .
member.exception: The path contains one or more of the invalid characters defined in , or contains a wildcard character.
